benefits.title: 5-Hydroxytryptophan Suppresses the Abdominal Fat Deposit and Is Beneficial to the Intestinal Immune Function in Broilers
benefits.summary: 5-HTP supplementation reduces abdominal fat accumulation and is beneficial to intestinal immune function in broiler chickens.

benefits.title: Efficacy of 5-HT3 Antagonists and 5-HT4 Agonists in Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
benefits.summary: 5-HT3 antagonists, such as alosetron, cilansetron, and tegaserod, are effective in treating IBS, with a similar benefit for both alosetron and cilansetron.

benefits.title: The medical benefit of 5-HT research
benefits.summary: 5-HTP research has led to the development of SSRIs for treating depression, anxiety, social phobia, PMD, migraine, and chemotherapy-induced emesis.

benefits.title: New insight into the therapeutic role of the serotonergic system in Parkinson's disease
benefits.summary: 5-HTP can provide benefits in the treatment of Parkinson's disease by modulating extrapyramidal motor disorders, cognitive impairment, mood disorders, and psychosis.

benefits.title: Increasing serotonin concentrations alter calcium and energy metabolism in dairy cows.
benefits.summary: 5-HTP treatment in late-lactation dairy cows improved energy metabolism, decreased calcium loss into urine, and increased calcium secretion into milk.

benefits.title: Treatment of myoclonus with l‐5‐hydroxytryptophan and carbidopa: Clinical, electrophusiological, and biochemical observations
benefits.summary: L-5-HTP therapy can decrease spontaneous myoclonus and action myoclonus, but side effects like gastrointestinal and affective disturbances limit its usefulness.

benefits.title: 5-HT4 Receptors
benefits.summary: 5-HT4 receptors affect specific neurological and psychiatric functions, potentially benefiting specific central nervous system disorders.

benefits.title: Elevation of circulating serotonin improves calcium dynamics in the peripartum dairy cow.
benefits.summary: 5-HTP infusion prepartum improves calcium dynamics in dairy cows, potentially preventing hypocalcemia during the transition from pregnancy to lactation.

benefits.title: Construction of cell factory capable of efficiently converting l-tryptophan into 5-hydroxytryptamine
benefits.summary: 5-HTP is an inhibitory neurotransmitter with proven benefits for treating the symptoms of depression.

benefits.title: Enhanced production of 5-hydroxytryptophan through the regulation of L-tryptophan biosynthetic pathway
benefits.summary: 5-HTP is used for the treatment of various diseases such as depression, insomnia, chronic headaches, and binge eating associated obesity.

side effects.title: Behavioral, neuroendocrine and biochemical effects of different doses of 5-HTP in panic disorder
side effects.summary: Dose-related increase in side effects like nausea, dizziness, and fatigue occur with higher doses of 5-HTP.

side effects.title: Pharmacology of rising oral doses of 5-hydroxytryptophan with carbidopa
side effects.summary: Nausea and vomiting occur dose-dependently as the most frequent side effects of 5-HTP combined with CBD.

side effects.title: Placebo-Controlled Comparison of Three Dose-Regimens of 5-Hydroxytryptophan Challenge Test in Healthy Volunteers
side effects.summary: 5-HTP 100 mg plus carbidopa is a simple, effective, and tolerable challenge of the presynaptic serotonergic system, but may induce some nausea in three participants.

side effects.title: Treatment of myoclonus with l‐5‐hydroxytryptophan and carbidopa: Clinical, electrophusiological, and biochemical observations
side effects.summary: Side effects of L-5-HTP therapy include gastrointestinal and affective disturbances.

side effects.title: 5-Hydroxytryptophan: A precursor of serotonin influences regional blood-brain barrier breakdown, cerebral blood flow, brain edema formation, and neuropathology.
side effects.summary: 5-HTP-neurotoxicity, caused by blood-brain barrier breakdown, edema formation, and nitric oxide production, is instrumental in causing adverse mental and behavioral abnormalities.

side effects.title: L-5-hydroxytryptophan alone and in combination with a peripheral decarboxylase inhibitor in the treatment of depression.
side effects.summary: Gastrointestinal side effects are dose-dependent and more frequent in patients receiving L-5-HTP alone, while psychopathological side effects (especially acute anxiety states) are more frequent in patients receiving L-5-HTP in combination with a peripheral decarboxylase inhibitor.

side effects.title: Serotonin and myoclonus.
side effects.summary: L-5-HTP with carbidopa can decrease myoclonus frequency and intensity, but may cause anorexia, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and mental stimulation.

side effects.title: Mutations in monoamine oxidase (MAO) genes in mice lead to hypersensitivity to serotonin-enhancing drugs: implications for drug side effects in humans
side effects.summary: 5-HTP can cause serotonin syndrome in mice lacking the MAOA and MAOB genes, potentially affecting human vulnerability to the side effect.

side effects.title: Serotonergic modulation of extrapyramidal motor disorders in mice and rats: Role of striatal 5-HT3 and 5-HT6 receptors
side effects.summary: 5-HTP enhances haloperidol-induced bradykinesia and catalepsy in mice and rats.

side effects.title: Enhanced tolerability of the 5-hydroxytryptophane challenge test combined with granisetron
side effects.summary: 5-HTP/CBD combined with granisetron suppresses nausea and vomiting without affecting the neuroendocrine response or pharmacokinetics.

dosage.title: Behavioral, neuroendocrine and biochemical effects of different doses of 5-HTP in panic disorder
dosage.summary: Different dosages of 5-HTP, including 10 mg, 20 mg, and 40 mg, did not induce panic or anxiety in panic disorder patients and healthy controls.

dosage.title: Influence of Griffonia simplicifolia on male sexual behavior in rats: behavioral and neurochemical study.
dosage.summary: Acute treatment with 50 and 100 mg/kg of 5-HTP from Griffonia simplicifolia seed extract significantly increased mount latency, intromission and ejaculation latencies, and post-ejaculatory interval in rats.
dosage.journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

dosage.title: A FURTHER STUDY ON ALLEVIATION OF THE PSYCHOLOGICAL EFFECTS OF LSD IN MAN BY PRETREATMENT WITH 5-HYDROXYTRYPTOPHAN.
dosage.summary: The dosage of 5-HTP used (25 mg) did not distinguish between LSD injections, but its moderating effects were apparent in psychometric tests.

dosage.title: The effect of high doses of 5-hydroxytryptophan on a patient with trisomy 21. Clinical, chemical and EEG correlations.
dosage.summary: High doses of 5-hydroxytryptophan (up to 97.8 mg/kg) can cause mild hypertonic muscular tone, bucco-lingual dyskinesia, and psychomotor retardation in patients with trisomy 21.

dosage.title: Behavioral correlates of serotonin depletion.
dosage.summary: Dosages of 75 mg/kg DL-5-hydroxytryptophan (5-HTP) and 37.5 mg/kg L-5-HTP were administered to medical forebrain bundle lesioned rats to return their pain threshold to normal values.

dosage.title: Repeated oral ingestion of 5-hydroxytryptophan. The effect on behavior and sleep processes in two schizophrenic children.
dosage.summary: Oral D, L-5-hydroxytryptophan (5-HTP) at a dosage of 3.0 mg/kg/24 hr was administered to two schizophrenic children for eight days.

dosage.title: Clinical characteristics of epileptic seizures in a case of dihydropteridine reductase deficiency
dosage.summary: The dosage of 5-HTP in this case was 670 mg/day.

dosage.title: 5-Htp In Migraine Headache Treatment: Actual Views And Perspectives
dosage.summary: Chronic 5-HTP treatment improved clinical symptoms in patients with common migraine, with dosages ranging from 1.5 to 600 mg/day.

dosage.title: Serotonin and the aversive threshold in rats
dosage.summary: 5-HTP significantly raised the aversive threshold to moderate levels at 95- and 125-mg/kg dosages, while motor activity was reduced at 60-, 70-, 95-, and 125-mg/kg dosages.

dosage.title: [Effect of the time of administration of 5-hydroxytryptophan on the restoration of circadian stimulation of ACTH secretion in rats treated with p-chlorophenylalanine].
dosage.summary: The dosage of 5-HTP needed to restore circadian ACTH stimulation in rats was 60 mg/kg i.p. at 11.00 h.
dosage.journal: Comptes rendus des seances de la Societe de biologie et de ses filiales
